Articles.Content: I've got a VTOHL (Vertical Take-Off, Horizontal Landing to the uninitiated) rocket plane that MechJeb just does NOT agree with. Even the slightest roll input causes wild swaying, and it promptly departs controlled flight. other than disabling the control surfaces manually during the launch phase and relying on thrust vectoring and reaction wheels, does anyone have any ideas as to how to dampen the responsiveness of the control surfaces?

What routine of MechJeb are you running that's causing the trouble? Although I think MJ at present has a lot of problems doing everything except defining (but not executing) maneuver nodes and following the ascent profile parameters you give it, so use at your own risk.

Trying to do an ascent to orbit under the command of the Ascent Guidance routine. Normally it's no problem, but MechJeb and my spaceplane designs tend to not mix well. MJ seems to need planes that fly like bricks, not ones that handle well under manual control.
To dampen input you can hit the CAPS LOCK key in flight to dampen control inputs.

So is this a Dreamchaser? If so, then your problem is aerodynamics, not MJ. As speed increases during ascent, the wings on top produce more and more asymmetrical lift, and also drag at the front instead of the back. This pretty much always results in tumbling rockets unless you put even bigger wings on the lifter to overpower those on the nose, plus beaucoup torque and RCS to then force this over-stabilized machine onto the desired path.

It's actually easiest to do VTOHL with 2 identical planes, one on each side of the rocket, so their lift cancel out. And put them at the bottom of the rocket so they act as the rocket's tail fins during ascent.

https://www.flickr.com/photos/39416639@N02/17727503938/in/album-72157652773078908/

If it's just a wobbly rocket, then you can reduce the gimbal authority of the engines of that stage by tweaking them in the VAB. I had to do that with an Apollo replica - 20% gimbal on the Mammoth first stage, 50% gimbal on the Rhino 2nd stage, full authority for the Skipper third stage.

Oh, and adding struts to reduce wobble. Lots of struts.

However, what it sounds like from the opening post is that you have a lot of control surfaces near the front of your ship, a lift imbalance, and I suspect that disabling the surfaces is probably the best move you can make.
